body: did you do a `go get -u github.com/go-openapi/runtime` ?
Don't forget to also re-generate the relevant output (`swagger generate {args...}`) after running `go get -u github.com/go-openapi/runtime`.
@daved   Does not seem to work for me. Still getting swag.IsZero undefined.

the latest version of swagger tells you which dependencies you have to vendor.
But can you share your spec so I can try it in a docker container. The error message is a bit vague like this and that makes it hard to troubleshoot

@kyteague is this still an issue for you?
From version 0.7.0 we print the dependencies you require

For me this is still a problem.

I'm starting out with an empty `$GOPATH` and a the swagger `0.7.4` binary.
Following the simple server tutorial I generate the `swagger.yml` with:

```
swagger init spec \
  --title "A To Do list application" \
  --description "The product of a tutorial on goswagger.io" \
  --version 1.0.0 \
  --scheme http \
  --consumes application/io.goswagger.examples.todo-list.v1+json \
  --produces application/io.goswagger.examples.todo-list.v1+json
```

Which finishes with the message:

```
For this generation to compile you need to have some packages in your GOPATH:

  * github.com/go-openapi/runtime
  * github.com/tylerb/graceful
  * github.com/jessevdk/go-flags
  * golang.org/x/net/context
```
I `go get -u` those and add a simple hello world get handler that returns a string and 200 to the swagger spec. Then I try to build the server with `go build -v cmd/a-to-do-list-application-server/main.go`.
It failes on missing packages:
- `github.com/go-openapi/analysis`
- `github.com/go-openapi/loads`
- `github.com/go-openapi/spec`
- `github.com/go-openapi/validate`
- `github.com/gorilla/context`

After installing those I try to compile again and finally get the message this issue is built on:

```bash
[rio@ravage testserver]$ go build -v cmd/a-to-do-list-application-server/main.go 
github.com/go-openapi/runtime/middleware/denco
github.com/go-openapi/runtime/middleware/header
github.com/go-openapi/runtime/middleware/untyped
github.com/go-openapi/runtime/security
github.com/go-openapi/runtime/middleware
testserver/restapi/operations
# testserver/restapi/operations
restapi/operations/a_to_do_list_application_api.go:57: undefined: swag in swag.CommandLineOptionsGroup
```

Running `swagger generate server --spec swagger.yml` again will fix this with this diff:

```diff
diff --git a/restapi/operations/a_to_do_list_application_api.go b/restapi/operations/a_to_do_list_application_api.go
index 19060b2..e7942cc 100644
--- a/restapi/operations/a_to_do_list_application_api.go
+++ b/restapi/operations/a_to_do_list_application_api.go
@@ -13,6 +13,7 @@ import (
        middleware "github.com/go-openapi/runtime/middleware"
        spec "github.com/go-openapi/spec"
        strfmt "github.com/go-openapi/strfmt"
+       "github.com/go-openapi/swag"
 )
 
 // NewAToDoListApplicationAPI creates a new AToDoListApplication instance
diff --git a/restapi/operations/get_parameters.go b/restapi/operations/get_parameters.go
index 8524a0c..941e437 100644
--- a/restapi/operations/get_parameters.go
+++ b/restapi/operations/get_parameters.go
@@ -7,6 +7,7 @@ import (
        "net/http"
 
        "github.com/go-openapi/errors"
+       "github.com/go-openapi/runtime/middleware"
 )
 
 // NewGetParams creates a new GetParams object
diff --git a/restapi/server.go b/restapi/server.go
index 1a23589..a92af06 100644
--- a/restapi/server.go
+++ b/restapi/server.go
@@ -10,6 +10,7 @@ import (
        "sync"
        "time"
 
+       "github.com/go-openapi/swag"
        flags "github.com/jessevdk/go-flags"
        graceful "github.com/tylerb/graceful"
```

So it does seem the swag  and middleware import is not coming through on first generation.
Also the first generation message is missing some packages.
I think if you start with `github.com/go-openapi/validate` it gets the rest of the ones that you need.
I remember talking to @casualjim about this, and if I remember correctly, he was surprised that `go-openapi/runtime` didn't pull in `go-openapi/validate`.

I was able to reproduce that with glide, gvt otoh does everything as I expect

related: #818

issue.title: Does not run from a subdirectory of project in GOPATH
issue.body:
## Problem statement

Does not run from a subdirectory in $GOPATH/src.

## Steps to reproduce

```sh
somewhere/on/gopath$ cd subdir && swagger generate server
2017/01/22 06:43:08 building a plan for generation
2017/01/22 06:43:08 target must reside inside a location in the $GOPATH/src
```

## Workaround
```sh
somewhere/on/gopath$ swagger generate server --target=subdir
[generates]
```

I'd use the workaround, but I have the command in `subdir/Makefile` and running with `make -C subdir`.

body:
it's not solved for me. I still need to do another `swagger generate` to get the proper imports set. I've even got one extra that's missing:
```
restapi/operations/get_parameters.go:31: undefined: middleware in middleware.MatchedRoute
restapi/operations/todo_list_api.go:57: undefined: swag in swag.CommandLineOptionsGroup
```

issue.title: Add default imports in templates
issue.body:
In case go-imports failed to scan vendor directory the generated code
have missing imports.
This commit add default imports that will be remove by go-imports if the
generate code not needed them.

Fix #656
